content: Patient presents with complaints of persistent headache for the past 3 days, described as throbbing pain in the frontal region. Pain rated as 7/10. Reports no visual disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Patient has history of migraine. Vital signs within normal limits. Neurological exam unremarkable. Assessment: Migraine headache. Plan: Prescribed sumatriptan 50mg as needed, recommended hydration and stress reduction techniques. Follow-up in 2 weeks if symptoms persist.

medications.name: Ibuprofen
medications.frequency: Every 6 hours as needed for pain

content: Patient was admitted on 3/30/2025 with acute appendicitis. Underwent laparoscopic appendectomy on 3/30/2025 without complications. Post-operative course was uneventful. Patient tolerated regular diet on post-op day 1. Pain well controlled with oral analgesics. Discharged home in stable condition with follow-up appointment scheduled in 2 weeks. Discharge medications include acetaminophen/hydrocodone for 3 days and prophylactic antibiotics for 7 days. Patient instructed on wound care, activity restrictions, and signs of infection to monitor for.

medications.name: Acetaminophen/Hydrocodone
medications.frequency: Every 6 hours as needed for pain

content:
EXAMINATION: Chest X-ray, PA and Lateral

CLINICAL INDICATION: Shortness of breath, cough for 1 week

TECHNIQUE: PA and lateral chest radiographs were obtained.

FINDINGS: Heart size is normal. Pulmonary vascularity is within normal limits. There is patchy opacity in the right lower lobe consistent with pneumonia. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is identified. No acute osseous abnormality.

IMPRESSION: Right lower lobe pneumonia. Recommend clinical correlation and follow-up radiograph after treatment to ensure resolution.

medications.name: Dextromethorphan
medications.frequency: Every 4 hours as needed for cough
